titlepage.titleproper: Overview of the George Adam Lange Papers
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

defitem.label: Encoded by:
defitem.item: Machine-readable finding aid derived from MARC record by David Sun.

titlepage.p: © 2008 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Orders, reports, correspondence, memorabilia, and photographs, relating to American naval operations, especially in the Pacific Theater during World War II, and to Franklin D. Roosevelt.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George Adam Lange papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1979.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rear admiral, United States Navy; executive officer, presidential yacht Potomac, and aide to President Franklin D. Roosevelt, 1940-1942; navigator and executive officer, U.S.S. Columbia, 1942-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Orders, reports, correspondence, memorabilia, and photographs, relating to American naval operations, especially in the Pacific Theater during World War II, and to Franklin D. Roosevelt.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1939-1945--Campaigns--Pacific Ocean.
World War, 1939-1945--Naval operations.

scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover
U.S. Atlantic Fleet Amphibious Force movement order

did.unittitle: Rest of collection not yet described
